title: Development of the Critical Reflection and Agency in Computing Index
source: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
contribution: We contribute a theory of computing ethics pedagogy, alongside the development of a scale to measure students' attitudes towards computing ethics.

title: Examining the Relationship between Socioeconomic Status and Beliefs about Large Language Models in an Undergraduate Programming Course
source: ACM Virtual Global Computing Education Conference
contribution: Socio-economic status was positively associated with believing LLM use will lead to career success in undergraduate students.

title: Do I Have a Say in This, or Has ChatGPT Already Decided for Me?
source: XRDS: Crossroads, The ACM Magazine for Students
contribution: We should attempt to be self-aware, set boundaries, with LLMs so that we are not as surprised by their effects when we use them.

title: Insights from Social Shaping Theory: The Appropriation of Large Language Models in an Undergraduate Programming Course
source: ACM Conference on International Computing Education Research
contribution: Students often internalize technological determinism narratives when deciding whether to adopt LLMs into their learning processes, however, after becoming self-aware about negative impacts on their learning, they often changed their behavior.

title: Undergraduate Student Attitudes towards a Social Justice Context in a Programming Project
source: ACM Technical Symposium on Computer Science Education
contribution: Our students supported social justice contexts and content within their programming education, and requested deeper dives and discussions that challenge their preconceived notions.

title: A Realist Review of Undergraduate Student Attitudes towards Ethical Interventions in Technical Computing Courses
contribution: Students attitudes towards ethics interventions in their technical courses are complex, following many pathways. Four theories were identified to help guide interventions towards success.

title: Multi-Institutional Multi-National Studies of Parsons Problems
source: ACM Innovation and Technology in Computer Science Education, Working Group Track
contribution: This article contributes an analysis of recent Parsons problem research papers, an itemization of considerations for MIMN studies, the results from our MIMN studies of Parsons problems, and a discussion of recent and future directions for MIMN studies of Parsons problems and more generally.

title: Putting a teaspoon of programming into other subjects
contribution: Task-specific programming (TSP) languages are an easy and helpful way of incorporating programming into broader subjects.

title: Critiquing Computing Artifacts through Programming Satirical Python Scripts
source: IEEE Research in Equity and Sustained Participation in Engineering, Computing, and Technology
contribution: Programming scripts containing egregious/satirized versions of Dr. Ruha Benjamin's "glitches" in software were a valuable way of critiquing computing artifacts.

title: desAIner: Exploring the Use of "Bad" Generative Adversarial Networks in the Ideation Process of Fashion Design
contribution: Some fashion designers don't like the incestuous nature of GANs trained on existing fashion, but were inspired by the amorphous images it generated.

title: The role of collaboration, creativity, and embodiment in AI learning experiences
contribution: Intimidation and age were two main inhibitors to collaborative interaction in AI literacy take-home museum exhibits.

title: Parqr: Automatic post suggestion in the piazza online forum to support degree seeking online masters students
contribution: Contributed a new tool, a recommendation engine, that helped students find previously answered questions on Piazza easily, reducing duplicate questions.
